>>>   
>>>   Key Information from Logs:
>>>   
>>>        * The validation attempt to access http://skillforge.it/.well-known/acme-challenge/<token> times out, which is commonly caused by network restrictions or routing/firewall issues.
>>>        * Disabling IPS, GeoIP, Antivirus, and Application Filter does not resolve the issue, and Kerio logs show no direct errors.
>>>   
>>>   Recommended Steps:
>>>   
>>>        * Ensure that the PBX server and/or Kerio Control device have explicit firewall rules allowing incoming HTTP/HTTPS connections for Let's Encrypt ACME challenge URLs. These must not be blocked or proxied during certificate requests.
>>>        * Verify that port 80 (HTTP) and port 443 (HTTPS) are accessible from the internet to the PBX server for the duration of certificate issuance. Let's Encrypt must be able to reach http://skillforge.it/.well-known/acme-challenge/ without interference.
>>>        * If you have SSL filtering or HTTPS inspection enabled, consider temporarily excluding Let's Encrypt domains and ACME challenge URLs, as SSL proxies can interfere with challenge validation.
>>>        * If your PBX is behind Kerio Control using NAT, confirm that port-forwarding rules are in place and not blocked by any other rules. For more guidance on address exclusions and update services, refer to this article: IPS, GeoIP, Antivirus, Product update fails due to server connection issues [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/116491].
>>>        * If problems persist only with version 10 and not on 9.5 SP3, review any changes in default firewall policies or NAT implementation introduced in the newer version and adjust rule sets as needed.

Kayako - ticket id 60210541 // Ciprian Nastase commented publicly: Dear Jozef,

 

Thank you for contacting GFI - Kerio Control Support, I understand that you are reporting PBX C3X stops working after an upgrade to Kerio Control V10.

Seeing that the error is referencing LetsEncrypt, can you please confirm if this issue wasn't actually related to the  GFI Software Status - Kerio Control UDP Traffic Issue [https://status.gfi.com/incidents/t8mvtt8m5gv2] from the status page?

If it isn't, please provide us with some additional details that we can use to troubleshoot, especially as we don't have any Kerio Control v10 appliances available for support:

	* Support Information File - KerioControl [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/117043-support-information-file] 
	* Error, warning and debug logs
	* Configuration backup export [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/119646-exporting-and-importing-configuration-backups]

Best regards,
Ciprian Nastase
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Kayako - ticket id 60210541 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Jozef,

Thank you for detailing the issue encountered with Let's Encrypt SSL/TLS certificate renewal and VoIP trunk/PBX functionality on Kerio Control version 10 build 9018, which appears to resolve upon downgrading to 9.5 SP3. Based on the log details provided—especially the timeout during the Let's Encrypt certificate authorization process—the most likely root cause relates to firewall or network routing impacting connectivity during certificate validation.

Key Information from Logs:

 	* The validation attempt to access http://skillforge.it/.well-known/acme-challenge/<token> times out, which is commonly caused by network restrictions or routing/firewall issues.
 	* Disabling IPS, GeoIP, Antivirus, and Application Filter does not resolve the issue, and Kerio logs show no direct errors.

Recommended Steps:

 	* Ensure that the PBX server and/or Kerio Control device have explicit firewall rules allowing incoming HTTP/HTTPS connections for Let's Encrypt ACME challenge URLs. These must not be blocked or proxied during certificate requests.
 	* Verify that port 80 (HTTP) and port 443 (HTTPS) are accessible from the internet to the PBX server for the duration of certificate issuance. Let's Encrypt must be able to reach http://skillforge.it/.well-known/acme-challenge/ without interference.
 	* If you have SSL filtering or HTTPS inspection enabled, consider temporarily excluding Let's Encrypt domains and ACME challenge URLs, as SSL proxies can interfere with challenge validation.
 	* If your PBX is behind Kerio Control using NAT, confirm that port-forwarding rules are in place and not blocked by any other rules. For more guidance on address exclusions and update services, refer to this article: IPS, GeoIP, Antivirus, Product update fails due to server connection issues [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/116491].
 	* If problems persist only with version 10 and not on 9.5 SP3, review any changes in default firewall policies or NAT implementation introduced in the newer version and adjust rule sets as needed.

Additional Reference:

For advanced troubleshooting related to access issues, you may want to consult the article Troubleshooting Access Issues to Specific Websites through Kerio Control Firewall [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/119709], particularly regarding situations where external access is required and timing out.

Please review your Kerio Control firewall and NAT rules as described. By ensuring proper rule configuration and exclusions for ACME challenge validation, Let's Encrypt operations and VoIP trunks should function without such errors on Kerio Control version 10.

Sincerely,
Atlas
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team.
